page.title: 06HEALTH IN BALFRON AREA
page.content: The{clinic}has one full-time and one part-time doctor and one full-time assistant doctor. There are four nurses, one health visitor and one full-time nursing officer. The dentist has one dental nurse and a chiropodist works part time in the clinic. In the practice there are 2461 patients, 303 of whom are over the age of 65. About 20 babies are born each year. The people of Balfron are more fortunate than most as regards health, because they live in an area where there are few{social problems,}little unemployment and where people are well motivated to look after themselves. The biggest problem in health care is the growth in the number of elderly people and the amount of{care}which is required, both in the community and in residential homes and hospitals, to look after them.
